place.name: HAYSCASTLE
place.gazetteerText: HAYS-CASTLE, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on West Cleddau river, 5½ miles NW of Clarbeston Road r. station, and 6½ N of Haverfordwest. It contains the villages of Brimstone and Ford; and its post-town is Wolfs-Castle, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 4,462. Real property, £1,866. Pop., 297. Houses, 62. The property is much subdivided. The living is a vicarage, annexed to the vicarage of Brawdy, in the diocese of St. Davids. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
